snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton said last week that the Syrian National Council had outlived its usefulness and should be replaced by a larger umbrella organization.
abstract: Syria's fractious opposition groups begin negotiations in Doha, Qatar, to forge a more unified front to reshape the political landscape in the country's bloody conflict; Sec of State Hillary Rodham Clinton has said existing union, the Syrian National Council, has outlived its usefulness and should be replaced by a larger umbrella organization.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton said last week that the Syrian National Council had outlived its usefulness and should be replaced by a larger umbrella organization.

headline.seo: Syria’s Rebels Open Talks on Forging United Political Front
headline.main: Syria’s Disparate Opposition Groups Open Talks on Forging United Political Front
headline.print_headline: Syria’s Disparate Opposition Groups Open Talks on Forging United Political Front
